intro: Pearsonia flava subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow pearsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in open habitats such as dunes and coastal scrub. Pearsonia flava subsp. flava plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native invertebrates.
